whitebox.stats.KrigingPoint

    whitebox.stats  

    • Uses of KrigingPoint in whitebox.stats

      Fields in whitebox.stats with type parameters of type KrigingPoint 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      java.util.List<KrigingPoint> Kriging.points 
      Methods in whitebox.stats that return types with arguments of type KrigingPoint 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.List<KrigingPoint> Kriging.calcInterpolationPoints()
      It calculates the location of each grid cell.
      java.util.List<KrigingPoint> Kriging.CrossValidationPoints(Kriging.Variogram variogram, java.util.List<KrigingPoint> pnts, int NumberOfNearestPoints)
      Gets the variogram and unknown point list and returns the interpolated values for the known points This is to calculate the predicted value for each known point, the result would be used for cross validation.
      java.util.List<KrigingPoint> Kriging.getPoints() 
      java.util.List<KrigingPoint> Kriging.interpolatePoints(Kriging.Variogram variogram, java.util.List<KrigingPoint> pnts, int numberOfNearestPoints)
      Gets the variogram and unknown point list and returns the interpolated values for the unknown points It also calculates the Kriging Variance and sets the KrigingPoint.V
      java.util.List<KrigingPoint> Kriging.RandomizePoints(java.util.List<KrigingPoint> pnts, int n)
      Randomly selects the n points from the entered point list This is not a necessary method to use but with large point list (More than 1000 points) It is better to apply it
      Method parameters in whitebox.stats with type arguments of type KrigingPoint 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void Kriging.buildRaster(java.lang.String outputRaster, java.util.List<KrigingPoint> pnts, boolean drawKrigingVariance)
      Produces the output raster
      java.util.List<KrigingPoint> Kriging.CrossValidationPoints(Kriging.Variogram variogram, java.util.List<KrigingPoint> pnts, int NumberOfNearestPoints)
      Gets the variogram and unknown point list and returns the interpolated values for the known points This is to calculate the predicted value for each known point, the result would be used for cross validation.
      void Kriging.DrawShapeFile(java.lang.String outputFile, java.util.List<KrigingPoint> pnts) 
      java.util.List<KrigingPoint> Kriging.interpolatePoints(Kriging.Variogram variogram, java.util.List<KrigingPoint> pnts, int numberOfNearestPoints)
      Gets the variogram and unknown point list and returns the interpolated values for the unknown points It also calculates the Kriging Variance and sets the KrigingPoint.V
      java.util.List<KrigingPoint> Kriging.RandomizePoints(java.util.List<KrigingPoint> pnts, int n)
      Randomly selects the n points from the entered point list This is not a necessary method to use but with large point list (More than 1000 points) It is better to apply it
